result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 2:39 pm
INCLUDES 14CF739 AND 16CF433.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Lesli Pluster:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Kat Jackan;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
14CF739:
Ct. 1 (Theft-Business Setting >$5000-$10,000)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
16CF433:
Ct. 1 (Sex Registry Violation)>> GUILTY.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
16CF433:
Ct. 1 (Sex Registry Violation)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation. CONDITIONS: Restitution in the amount of $7,093 to be paid at the rate of $200/Month, Counseling as recommended, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 12 Hours of Community Service per week, Comply with the Sex Offender Registry, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample unless already provided. Court finds 56 days credit. 

Adjourned: 2:46 pm
Bail/bond hearing on October 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.
and Defense Motion for Modification of Bond-stj

Includes 14CF739 and 16CF433.    No contact with Baltus Bread and Butter.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Comply with sex offender registry.
